Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.elementary

Class HeapSort<X extends Comparable<X>>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.generic.SortWithHelper<X>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.generic.SortWithComparableHelper<X>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.elementary.HeapSort<X>
Type Parameters:
X - The type of the elements to be sorted, which must extend Comparable.
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProcessingSort<X>, Sort<X>, AutoCloseable
public class HeapSort<X extends Comparable<X>> extends SortWithComparableHelper<X>
Implementation of the Heap Sort algorithm for sorting an array of elements that implement the Comparable interface. Heap Sort is an in-place, comparison-based sorting algorithm that uses a binary heap data structure.

The algorithm consists of two main phases: 1. Construction phase: The input array is transformed into a max-heap. 2. Sort-down phase: The largest element is repeatedly removed from the heap and placed at the end of the array, while the remaining heap is restored as a max-heap.

This class extends SortWithComparableHelper and provides specific sorting logic using the heap structure.

CONSIDER using the heapConstructor() method of PriorityQueue.

      public HeapSort(Helper<X> helper)
      Constructor for the HeapSort class. Initializes the HeapSort algorithm with a helper instance.
      Parameters:
      helper - The helper instance to assist with operations such as comparisons and swaps during the sorting process. The helper is typically a utility class that provides additional methods to facilitate sorting logic.

    • HeapSort

      public HeapSort(int nWords, Config config)

    • HeapSort

      public HeapSort(int nWords, int nRuns, Config config)

      Parameters:
      nWords - The number of words to be used for the sorting algorithm configuration.
      nRuns - The number of sorting runs or iterations to be managed by the algorithm.
      config - The configuration object that specifies settings and parameters for the HeapSort algorithm.

  • Method Details

    • sort

      public void sort(X[] array, int from, int to)
      Sorts the specified portion of the array using the heap sort algorithm. The method first constructs a max heap and then sorts the elements by repeatedly extracting the maximum element.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to be sorted. The array is modified in place. If the array is null or has a length of 1 or less, no operation is performed.
      from - the index of the first element in the portion to be sorted (inclusive). This parameter is currently ignored as the method sorts the entire array.
      to - the index of the last element in the portion to be sorted (exclusive). This parameter is currently ignored as the method sorts the entire array.
